answers.answer: You have to check your titers.12 years is awhile, you may need to get another shot now.
so you think i could have contracted this disease..whould i go get tested?
Well it is transmitted sexually.But I think mostly seen in gay men.I could be wrong on all this - HepB is not my thing.Ask your doc when you see him to get your test results.
I was vaccinated prior to my incident...but only one time (and I know it requires 3 full in total).  Does that help?  Do you know if one shot would protect me against hepB?  Just curious.
If you were vaccinated, you're fine. No worries.
so i shouldnt be worried..does the vaccine decline over time since i got all 3 shots in 95
i got the dates of my vaccine..3/95, 11/95 and 1/98..u think im ok

As far as I know, you don't need a booster for the HBV vaccine. No worries.nerviouskid: One shot doesn't really help. Two offers pretty okay protection, but one isn't enough. You definitely shouldn't worry about it, but you should go on and get vaccinated anyway. It's worth it.

thanks for your honesty and reply.  I appreciate it.I dont know now if I need to get HepB testing now....argh.I think they should have a cure for all STDs, including HIV.  Sex is rather painful in itself it seems.

Stop it. Don't worry about it. Sex is neither painful nor scary. It's fun, remember? Or it's supposed to be, anyway. To read these posts, though, it's nothing but a source of anguish and fear. It's depressing.Yes, sometimes you can get STDs. Most are curable, some are not. But then again, you're far more likely to get cancer, or diabetes, or heart disease, than you are HIV. Sex has some risks, but jesus, life is full of risks. Bad things happen sometimes, and that's just life. If you really want to be safe, sit inside your house with the shades drawn and the lights off; don't ever go out, don't talk on the phone, stay off the internet, don't use your stove. Or, you could take reasonable precautions and actually have a life worth living.If your fears are keeping you from having the kind of life you'd want--having relationships, having sex, whatever--or making you miserable in any way, then see a therapist. Don't let fear keep you from having a fulfilling life. Life's already too short. Why waste a minute of it?

that's true.  That's well said.I'm just getting out of this misery from waiting 3 months window period for HIV, which I get a negative result for, and then all of a sudden I hear HepB and Syphlis and all that ****.  you maybe surprised but this was my first time, so to have an experience of this nature in your very first encounter is rather horrific.  But I definitely see your point...and precautions from now on are in order for me for my own good.  Thanks.

Dude get your facts straight. HBV is NOT mainly seen it Gay men. The hightest is those that use IV drugs. Those that have multiple sex partners that have unprotected sex. Occupational hazards in health care settings. Mother to child during birth.

question: I had unprotected sex 9 months ago and i had an hiv test which came out negative and my doctor ordered test for kidneys, liver and all these tests...I have read that people can become infected with HepB through sexual contact but I recieved the vaccine in 1995...should I be worried?
title: hep B
